intro: Synactila viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered synactila, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are typically greenish-white in color, with five petals and prominent stamens. Synactila viridiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
